title.value: Estimating the lagged effect of price discounting: a time-series study using transaction data of sugar sweetened beverages.
title.justification: The provided title directly reflects the content and primary focus of the research paper.
title.quote: Title: Estimating the lagged effect of price discounting: a time-series study using transaction data of sugar sweetened beverages.

extractions.description: This paper examines the lagged effects of price discounting on the sales of sugar-sweetened beverages by employing a time-series analysis of transaction data from a supermarket in Montreal. Using a distributed lag model, the study evaluates whether sales continue to remain higher than baseline levels after the end of discounting periods. Findings indicate that while discounting increases sales during the discount period, a significant lagged effect is primarily seen with sports and energy drinks.

type.justification: The paper uses real transaction data and statistical modeling to investigate the effects of price discounting on sales, which characterizes it as an empirical study.
type.quote: This is a retrospective time-series study investigating the association between weekly discounting and sales of five SSB categories in a single supermarket located in Metropolitan Montreal, Canada.

name.justification: The paper applies econometric models, such as distributed lag models, to analyze time-series data on the impact of price discounting on sales.
name.quote: A lagged association between time-varying outcome (log-transformed sales quantity) and exposure (discounting) is commonly captured by a distributed lag model, which is a regression model that contains multiple time-lagged values of an exposure.

name.justification: The study explores how economic factors like price discounting affect consumer behavior in relation to health-impacting goods, namely sugar-sweetened beverages.
